_header: Thus cold and moist hot and dry
Note:
Sometimes incorporated in 4210; all texts show considerable variation; ed. Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, 393-96
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 1445 (SC 7630), Part VIII, I, ff. 45-46v: confused with 5095.
_description: George Ripley(?), alchemical verses ascribed to George Ripley — in couplets

BodAsh759.First Lines:
Thus cold and moist hotte and driebyn put togeder all for so did
                    I…
BodAsh759.Last Lines:
…And all is don in houres threWherfore it is callid Godis
                    prenyte

BodAsh1416.First Lines:
And yf ye will to this medcyn appliemake hem hote and
                    drie…
BodAsh1416.Last Lines: …cold & moiste drie & weetDo evenly I mete
BodAsh1416.Note:
10 lines. At the end: ‘Telos’. The poem has interlineary
                    corrections in a different hand.
BodAsh1416.Editions:
Black,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845.

BodAsh1448.First Lines:
Herd hevy hote & dryput to gedir for so did I
                    …
BodAsh1448.Last Lines:
…Than art þou richer þan the kyngeBut if he haue the
                    same þinge

BodAsh1479.First Lines:
Tak hevi softe collde & dryeclense hym & callce grynde
                    suttelly…
BodAsh1479.Last Lines:
…for I tell þe Ryght wellThare ys te dyademe of our
                    crafte
BodAsh1479.Note:
On f. 217: ‘Here folowyth a work very schort but not so schort as
                    yt ys true’. At the end: ‘finis laudes deo
                    prorsum’.

                    hotte & drye…
CamTCC1120.Last Lines:

                    connynge of suche a þynge
